intro: Discomela, commonly known as the false buttonweed, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. It comprises several species that are typically annual or perennial herbs, characterized by their small, clustered inflorescences. The plants often have slender stems and alternate leaves that are usually lance-shaped or ovate. Discomela species are native to various regions in Africa and are sometimes found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. They are not widely cultivated but may be considered weeds in certain agricultural settings.
